Posts.Title: Looking for different perspectives on breast cancer

Posts.Content: How old are you? Your mom? I think you are acting very strong doing what you are doing. Your mom sounds like she has a good prognosis, just some bad reactions. Keep her eating and drinking. She will get thru this and you will too. God Bless.
Posts.Title: Coping with my moms chemo for breast cancer

Posts.Content: How old are you? Your mom? I think you are acting very strong doing what you are doing. Your mom sounds like she has a good prognosis, just some bad reactions. Keep her eating and drinking. She will get thru this and you will too. God Bless.
Posts.Title: Coping with my moms chemo for breast cancer

Posts.Content: we are his primary caregivers and I can assure you I will make sure she is very comfortable. This is just such a shock. Two weeks ago she was healthy as a horse, we were at breakfast then went to the casino. A week later she got weak, yellowish and then this today. Â A CAT scan 3 mos ago was positive, the last one the other day was the end of treatment. I sat their today and watch a Dr tell a wonderful lady, she is out of options. I was in absolute shock. I called so many hospitals and when I mention billirubin of 10, they stop me and tell me Good Luck
Posts.Title: mother in law bad diagnosis

Posts.Content: My mother in law was diagnosed with Inflamatory Breast Cancer that went to the liver 2 years ago. She was doing awesome. A month ago her cancer markers went up. Today we met with the doctor. Her billirubin is 10, lesions on brain, liver and no more options. Is this really the end? How soon?
Posts.Title: mother in law bad diagnosis
